title: Gram - case - mea verba - Ovid Heroides 3

content.description:
Sola virum coniunx flexitflecto, -ere, flexi = persuadeo, -ere. Felicior illa! 
At mea propro, prep. (+ abl.): because of nullo ponderepondus, -eris, n.: weight verba cadunt.
content.question: In the passage, what is the case of mea verba?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
